intro: Ungernia ferganica, commonly known as the Fergana bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
